attributes.comment:
My family is currently going through an international adoption. We have been
made aware that there is a proposal to increase the fees of the immigration
servcies. We are aware that at some point, fees need to increase but the
increase is too much at one time. Adoption itself is an expensive process and
then to add more money for immigration puts an increased burden on those of us
trying to have a family. Sometimes, families end up paying the fee twice because
the paperwork has expired before an adoption is complete. Will the increased fees
also increase the amount of time the document is good for? Maybe if you just
increased the time the documents were good for than you wouldn't have so many
applications. The adoption process takes a long time and the immigration
paperwork so allow for the process to complete in a timely manner.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
